title: [Large-scale] Cohort-Based Integrated Dissertation Guidance Strategies for Successful Completion of Doctoral Programs in Education

context.prior_knowledge: Master’s degree or higher, foundational research methodology knowledge, and professional practice experience
context.additional_context: An intensive workshop for current professionals to systematically acquire the paper-writing process through cohort-based collaborative learning.

learning_goals: Learners collaboratively create a step-by-step roadmap—from topic selection to data analysis—with cohort members.

Learners can use an integrated thesis guidance model (e.g., ChatGPT-4o, Claude 3) to write one research design paper (over 5 pages), two literature analysis reports (each over 3 pages), and one results interpretation presentation (over 10 slides) within two weeks and submit revised versions reflecting over 80% of the advisor’s feedback for each deliverable.
Learners develop strategies to optimize time management and workload based on peer feedback and instructor support.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
